note.p: Education: King Edward School, Aberdeen?; Robert Gordon's College (1882); MD

Career: Conservator of Museum and Hunterian Professor, Royal College of Surgeons, London (1908-1933); Fullerian Professor of Physiology, Royal Institution (1917-1923); President, British Association (1927); Rector, Aberdeen University (1930-1933)
Obituaries: Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society 1955 vol 1 pp 145-161, plate, by W E Le Gros Clark
Notes: Discrepancy between dates in various sources; 05 February 1866 seems the most likely
